thread.title: North Korea Calls For Immediate Release Of Airport Assassination Suspects
thread.title_full: North Korea Calls For Immediate Release Of Airport Assassination Suspects

author: The Huffington Post News Team
title: North Korea Calls For Immediate Release Of Airport Assassination Suspects
text:
02/22/2017 04:26 am ET North Korea Calls For Immediate Release Of Airport Assassination Suspects A Vietnamese woman, an Indonesian woman and a North Korean man have been “arrested unreasonably,” the embassy said. 
KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 22 (Reuters) - The North Korean embassy in Malaysia said on Wednesday that the three suspects detained in the connection with the murder of Kim Jong Nam should be immediately released. 
A Vietnamese woman, an Indonesian woman and a North Korean man have been “arrested unreasonably,” the embassy said in a statement released to the media. 
Kim Jong Nam, the estranged half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, was killed at Kuala Lumpur International Airport last week while preparing to board a flight to Macau. 
Malaysian police said a senior official in the North Korean embassy and a staffer at its state airline, were also wanted for questioning over the murder. MORE:
